--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Elliotte Harold <elharo@m...> wrote:
> Robert wrote:
> 
> > Heck, as you said later, this is also what package-private is for. As
> > I've stated earlier, I use a default of package private when I extract
> > a new "public" class.
> 
> package private isn't public. I wish there a good standard word for 
> default access in Java, but there isn't. Still it definitely isn't 
> public. Whatever word you use for that that, please don't call it 
> public. You'll just confuse people.

I've consistently said that I extract classes out to package-private
first, and I make them public iff there is a need for it outside of
that package (this will usually entail moving it to a new package as
well).

You're the one who keeps referring to the creation of new classes as
creating public classes, Elliotte.

Robert.
